subject: Sales
title: The Power of Eye Contact
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Power of Eye Contact usable.

hook.text: Hold eye contact for three seconds and you have attention. Hold it for ten and you have authority.

buildup.text: Eye contact activates trust circuits in the brain. It signals confidence, presence, and genuine interest.

discovery.text: Research shows optimal conversational eye contact sits between 60% and 70% of speaking time.

twist.text: Too little feels evasive. Too much feels aggressive. The line between trust and threat is very narrow.

climax.text: Use the triangle technique: shift gaze between eyes and mouth. It feels natural to both speaker and listener.

punchline.text: The right eye contact builds trust. The wrong kind breaks it.

quiz.question: What is the optimal range for eye contact in conversation?
